intro: Pachylobus trapnellii, commonly known as the New Zealand tree fern, is a distinctive evergreen plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Cyatheaceae family and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and large, feather-like fronds. The plant has a robust root system that helps it thrive in moist, shaded environments. Its spore-producing structures, called sori, are located on the undersides of its fronds. Pachylobus trapnellii plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing shelter and food for various wildlife species.
